Debate about the Earth, Takeuchi, Uyeda & Kanamori, 1970, p.92-93

"All new theories, good or bad, have one common feature -- they differ from the prevailing belief at the time. It is easy to take a negative attitude and oppose a new idea on the strength of current belief ... Indeed what impresses us is the fact that, in so many cases, our great predecessors had pointed out many decades ago the ideas that are in the limelight today.
alfredsnippet.name: Phys.org Post - All Current Ideas Were Once Rejected
